intro: Hemicyclia sepiaria, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a short, upright stem with narrow, waxy leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating. Hemicyclia sepiaria is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
